timeline.bodyText:
The line is 106 characters long, which exceeds the traditional size for small terminals of 80 chars. At least it should not be indented.
To my taste it's also a bit splashy, something more meek like this would suffice:
$ ./jet sql
Connected to Hazelcast Jet 4.4 at 127.0.0.1:5007 (+1 more)
Type 'help' for instructions
sql>

The version 4.4 is the cluster version, not client's. The IP is the IP of the 1st member, the +1 more indicates the cluster size (2 in this case).
The prompt can be just sql>. If we happen to connect to an imdg cluster, jet commands would not work.
The need to use ; and the Ctrl+C will be in the help, many people can figure them out i think.

replies.bodyText: It can connect to an IMDG cluster. ./jet -v sql --targets dev@localhost:5701(dev -> default cluster name for IMDG) this command can be used to connect IMDG cluster running on localhost:5701. In the starting prompt, the sql console indicate which type of cluster (Jet or IMDG) the client connected to. I will also update the docs link in the help command to show the imdg documentation in case the client is connected to imdg.

timeline.message:
Workaround the jline race in signal handlers

See https://github.com/jline/jline3/pull/629
Change the starting prompt wrt. review comment

Simplify the code

- Replace isOneLineComment() and isMultilineComment functions with
one liners
- Add comments
Allow special commands to run without semicolon

Remove Set.of() usage to be Java 8 compatible

Also, remove dot usages from prompts

Fix history index issue

History index points the last item and when this last item was removed
the index did not shift to the previous one. Fix the issue resulting
from this by explicitly calling hist.resetIndex().
Determine column widths wrt. column types
Right-aline the number type of columns
Indicate whether the client connected to the imdg or jet cluster

Update help prompt

Change help prompt to refer the imdg sql doc when the client connected
 to imdg cluster.
Retry cluster connect forever in sql console
Retry cluster connect forever in sql console
Suppress findbugs warning since it generates false positive
